title: Bake Off winner: David crowned champion in incredible final
text:
David has only gone and won it! (Picture: Channel 4)

David Atherton has won the Great British Bake Off 2019, beating Steph Blackwell and Alice Fevronia in a nailbiting final.

Judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood came to their decision after the three bakers had been tasked to step into the infamous tent one last time for their signature, technical and showstopper bakes.

‘I am delighted to tell you after 10 weeks of intense competition the winner of the 2019 Great British Bake Off is David,’ presenter Sandi Toksvig said.

Paul enthused: ‘You smashed it, you smashed it, just at the right time.’

Delighted by his victory, David said: ‘I have watched this since the second series. For nine years I have been daydreaming about Bake Off, it wasn’t in my mind I could win this.

‘I was always the underdog but I managed to get through.’

The magical moment when David was crowned the winner of The Great British Bake Off 2019. #GBBOFinal pic.twitter.com/5e2parE8Ve — British Bake Off (@BritishBakeOff) October 29, 2019

The final three (Love Productions)

David, who takes on the title from last year’s champ Rahul Mandal, added: ‘Getting to the final was a win for me, so it feels so good. It has been weeks and weeks of intensity, and it’s just the best feeling in the world.’

Steph, Alice and David battled it out in a tense final episode, which saw the trio put through their paces.

The bakers were tasked with making a chocolate cake as their signature bake, on top of mastering the perfect souffle for the technical challenge.

For their last ever showstopper, David, Steph and Alice were asked to create an edible illusion using only cake, sweet bread and biscuits.

Although another year of Bake Off is over, there is good news as it will be returning in 2020 for an 11th season.

Not much has been revealed except the fact that producers have opened online applications for hopeful bakers.

The Great British Bake Off is available for catch-up on 4OD.
